articles.title: Traitors' Shameless Intention Brought to Light
S. Korean Troops' Preparations in Iraq for War against North Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Troops' Preparations in Iraq for War against North Denounced 
    Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean troops have stepped up their preparations for a war of aggression against the north while participating in the Iraqi war under the signboard of "peace and reconstruction".
 In this regard Minju Joson Sunday in a signed commentary says that any attempt to invade the north is intolerable in any case.    
 The south Korean troops have conducted more than 2,900 military drills independently or together with the U.S. troops in Iraq for a year last.
 South Korea's military operations in Iraq are being done according to the U.S. strategy for a war of aggression against the DPRK, in which the U.S. troops take charge of maritime and air battles and the south Korean troops ground battles.
 The south Korean authorities are working hard to increase the capability for a war of aggression against the north while extending the period of troop presence in Iraq, quite contrary to the will of the Korean nation. All these facts show that the south Korean authorities' troop dispatch to Iraq was not forced by the U.S. but an initiative one for confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.    
 The south Korean authorities would be advised to immediately stop making reckless preparations to do harm to the fellow countrymen behind the scene while paying lip-service to reconciliation and cooperation. They should withdraw their troops from Iraq at once.

Fidel Castro Sends Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Fidel Castro Sends Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy 
    Havana, September 9 (KCNA) -- Fidel Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Havana on September 9 to congratulate the 57th anniversary of the DPRK.

Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Havana
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Havana 
    Havana, September 9 (KCNA) -- Raul Castro Ruz, minister of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, and Felipe Ferez Roque, foreign minister of Cuba, sent floral baskets respectively to the DPRK embassy in Havana on September 8 and 9 to celebrate the 57th anniversary of the DPRK.
 Meanwhile, officials of the Cuban Foreign Ministry including Vice-Minister Jose Armando Guerra Menchero sent bouquets to the DPRK embassy on September 9.

articles.title: Information Bulletin Released in Bulgaria on DPRK's National Day
articles.content:
Information Bulletin Released in Bulgaria on DPRK's National Day 
    Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The special envoy of Nepalese King Gyanendra Bir Bikram Shah Dev visited the DPRK embassy in Kathmandu on September 9 on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the DPRK.
 The special envoy conveyed to DPRK Ambassador Hwang Yong Hwan the best wishes of the Nepalese king for good health and happiness of Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, and for progress and prosperity of the Korean people on the occasion.

articles.title: Joint Seminar Held in India
articles.content:
Joint Seminar Held in India
    Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar of the Indian organizations for the study of the Juche idea was held in New Delhi on September 3 on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the DPRK.
 Debabrata Vishwanath, secretary general of the "International Kim Il Sung Prize" Council who is also director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, made a report at the seminar.    
 He said that the revolutionary cause of Songun pioneered by President Kim Il Sung has been firmly defended and successfully carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il.
 The Songun politics of Kim Jong Il is based on the Juche idea, he said, adding: The might and vitality of the Songun idea have been fully demonstrated by the reality of Korea.    
 The DPRK has achieved the single-minded unity of the leader, the party, the army and the people, the strongest unity, and demonstrated its might as a powerful state independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in defence.
 Noting that the future of socialist Korea has been firmly guaranteed by Kim Jong Il loyal to the cause of Kim Il Sung, the reporter stressed that Kim Jong Il has wisely led the Korean people's building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation, frustrating all the moves of the U.S. with his Songun politics. Speeches were made there by chiefs of organizations for the study of the Juche idea.

Greetings to Tajik FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Tajik FM
    Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his Tajik counterpart Talbak Nazarov on the occasion of the national day of Tajikistan.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the mutual interests and wished the Tajik foreign minister greater success in his responsible work.

Women Delegation of South Korea Here
articles.content:
Women Delegation of South Korea Here
    Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the women's organizations in south Korea led by Jong Hyon Baek, permanent representative of the Women's Headquarters of the South Side's Preparatory Committee for Joint Functions of Koreans in the South and North and Overseas for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, arrived here Saturday.
 The delegation was greeted at the airport by Kim Kyong Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Women's Subcommittee of the North Side's Preparatory Committee for Joint Functions, and other women officials.    
 The head of the delegation made public an arrival statement at the airport.

articles.title: Congratulations to Syrian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Syrian President
    Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, sent a congratulatory message to Bashar al-Assad, regional  secretary of the Arab Baath Socialist Party and Syrian president, on Sept. 10 on the latter's 40th birthday.
 In the belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished the president good health and happiness and greater success in his responsible work to protect the sovereignty and dignity of the Arab nation and seek a fair and comprehensive solution to the Mideast issue.
